$ZIM TNP has a 11 PE and pays a measly 1% dividend compared to ZIM .5 PE and obviously huge dividend
created_at: relatively in same industry. And TNP share price is $17 - now that's the joke of the day. Yes forward looking profits and dividends for 2023/24 will be less however still way ahead of so many other stocks. The question no one can answer is just what will ZIMs profits be in 2023/24 and what divy will come from that. Even a  $4 annual dividend for a couple years would beat the majority of stocks on ROI at this SP and beat inflation. With an $8 or more divy coming in Q4 I can't find a better mid to long term play.
